Raskolnikov's Visit

(Raskolnikov at a dark staircase, tense mood)  
He hesitates, searching for Kapernaumov's door.  

Raskolnikov: “It’s I … come to see you.”  

Sonia: “Good heavens!”  

(Sonia in a tiny entry, candle flickering)  
She’s startled, emotions swirling.  

Raskolnikov: “Which is your room? This way?”  

Sonia: “Wait… I’m not ready.”  

---
(Raskolnikov in Sonia's room, anxiety thick)  
Sonia stands, candle trembling in her hand.  

Sonia: “Why are you here?”  

Raskolnikov: “I had to see you.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov visits Sonia at her home, finding her surprised and agitated by his unexpected arrival.
